qas.question: In what period did Africa beak off from Antarctica?
When was Antarctica still joined to Australia?
What type of climate did Antarctica have in the Cretaceous period?
When did Australia separate from Antarctica?
After the division from Australia, what began to appear?

What did Antactica connect to in the Jurassic?

What currents began isolating Australia in 66 Ma

What took place about 43 million years ago?
What was found to be 670ppm about 34 million years ago?

context: <b5_0><b9_0>Africa<b5_0/> separated from Antarctica<b9_0/> in the <a0_0>Jurassic<a0_0/>, around 160 Ma, followed by the Indian subcontinent in the early Cretaceous (about 125 Ma). By the <a1_0>end of the <b7_0>Cretaceous<b7_0/><a1_0/>, about 66 Ma, Antarctica (then connected to <b6_0>Australia<b6_0/>) still had a <a2_0>subtropical<a2_0/> climate and flora, complete with a marsupial fauna. <b10_0>In the <a3_0>Eocene epoch<b10_0/><a3_0/>, about 40 Ma Australia-New Guinea separated from Antarctica, so that <b8_0>latitudinal currents<b8_0/> could isolate Antarctica from Australia, and the first <a4_0>ice<a4_0/> began to appear. During the <b11_0>Eocene–Oligocene extinction event<b11_0/> about 34 million years ago, <b12_0>CO2 levels<b12_0/> have been found to be about 760 ppm and had been decreasing from earlier levels in the thousands of ppm.
